channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOJ sues Ticketmaster and Live Nation; the dangers of sharing kids' photos online
item.description: The Justice Department is suing Ticketmaster and its owner, Live Nation, accusing it of being a monopoly. And, here's why you should think twice before posting a photo of your kid online.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department is suing Ticketmaster and its owner, Live Nation, accusing it of being a monopoly. And, here's why you should think twice before posting a photo of your kid online.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: What to know about South Africa's May 29 elections
item.description: Pollsters and analysts say these could be the most pivotal elections since the country's first democratic vote 30 years ago, in 1994. Here's what's at stake.
item.content:encoded:
Pollsters and analysts say these could be the most pivotal elections since the country's first democratic vote 30 years ago, in 1994. Here's what's at stake.

(Image credit: Olympia De Maismont)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: A mega-gift for an HBCU college fell through. Here's what happened — and what's next
item.description: To people who watch high-level philanthropy, Florida A&M's embarrassing incident wasn't only a shocking reversal. It was something they've seen before. The school is now investigating what went wrong.
item.content:encoded:
To people who watch high-level philanthropy, Florida A&M's embarrassing incident wasn't only a shocking reversal. It was something they've seen before. The school is now investigating what went wrong.

(Image credit: Jeffrey Greenberg)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Abortion can be difficult to talk about. These 14 strangers took it on anyway
item.description: Over three days, 14 people with different backgrounds from all over Wisconsin met in person to discuss abortion policy and discovered how far they could get.
item.content:encoded:
Over three days, 14 people with different backgrounds from all over Wisconsin met in person to discuss abortion policy and discovered how far they could get.

(Image credit: Maayan Silver)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Memorial Day weekend travel to be congested with severe weather on the way
item.description: AAA says this year’s total number of travelers is a 4% increase from 2023 and is coming close to matching 2005’s record of 44 million Memorial Day travelers.
item.content:encoded:
AAA says this year’s total number of travelers is a 4% increase from 2023 and is coming close to matching 2005’s record of 44 million Memorial Day travelers.

(Image credit: George Walker IV/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Norfolk Southern reaches a multi-million-dollar settlement over Ohio train derailment
item.description: Among other fees, they will pay $235 million for the Environmental Protection Agency's past and future clean-up for contaminated air, water, and soil in and around where the train derailed in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
Among other fees, they will pay $235 million for the Environmental Protection Agency's past and future clean-up for contaminated air, water, and soil in and around where the train derailed in 2023.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: A verbal spat between Reps. Crockett and Greene highlights racial and gender tensions
item.description: After Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene insulted the appearance of Rep. Jasmine Crockett, a controversial, viral moment was born.
item.content:encoded:
After Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene insulted the appearance of Rep. Jasmine Crockett, a controversial, viral moment was born.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Meeting the Gangs that Control Haiti
item.description: After a long decline of the government in Haiti, gangs have seized complete control. A multi-national force is being sent to Haiti to restore the government to power, but their success is not assured. We go to Port-au-Prince, Haiti to see the challenges this international mission will face.
item.content:encoded: After a long decline of the government in Haiti, gangs have seized complete control. A multi-national force is being sent to Haiti to restore the government to power, but their success is not assured. We go to Port-au-Prince, Haiti to see the challenges this international mission will face.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Some NFL fans see disparities in its responses to Harrison Butker and Colin Kaepernick
item.description: NFL head Roger Goodell, reacting to Harrison Butker's controversial commencement speech, said the league values diversity of opinion. Some fans were quick to argue that hasn't always seemed the case.
item.content:encoded: NFL head Roger Goodell, reacting to Harrison Butker's controversial commencement speech, said the league values diversity of opinion. Some fans were quick to argue that hasn't always seemed the case.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: The U.N.'s top court says it will rule Friday on Israel's offensive in Gaza
item.description: The U.N.'s top court is expected to issue an order Friday on Israel’s offensive in Gaza, potentially ordering Israel to halt the operation. The case was brought by South Africa.
item.content:encoded:
The U.N.'s top court is expected to issue an order Friday on Israel’s offensive in Gaza, potentially ordering Israel to halt the operation. The case was brought by South Africa.

(Image credit: Remko de Waal)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz
